abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Additional
            Financing for the Small and Medium Enterprise (SME)
            Financing and Development Project is to improve SME access
            to finance (particularly longer term financing) and business
            development services, thereby fostering SME growth,
            competitiveness and employment creation, which are key to
            achieving Government of India's (GoI's) overall
            objectives of economic growth and poverty reduction. The
            closing date of the project will be extended from June 30,
            2012 to June 30, 2013.The main reason for seeking an
            extension of the closing date is to allow for time to
            implement the risk sharing facility of the project, which
            had been delayed on primarily on account of lack of
            budgeting, a factor outside of Small Industries Development
            Bank of India's (SIDBI's) control. Extension would
            allow the Bank team to continue to oversee and provide
            technical inputs on what is a particularly innovative
            component of the project, the Risk Sharing Facility (RSF).
            Extension will also allow SIDBI to channel the originally
            unallocated amount of US$ 9 million through further
            refinancing under the Credit Facility (CF), hence expanding
            the project's demonstration effect. In addition, a side
            benefit is that an extended project time period would allow
            for supporting greater dissemination of the project's
            Environment and Social Safeguards Framework (ESMF) to the
            banking system, a process that has been gained momentum
            recently, with strong initial results.
